cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west today, then turning WNW tonight and NW Friday, tracking toward the central-southeastern Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or southeastern Louisiana coast (near Morgan City, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas including metropolitan New Orleans; east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City (Tropical Storm Warning); Mouth of the Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, especially Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–45 kt) are possible with a 53% cumulative probability; 11% chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 1–3 ft is possible in Lake Pontchartrain and along adjacent low-lying areas near New Orleans, especially if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Very heavy rainfall of 10–15 inches with locally up to 20 inches expected across eastern Louisiana, including the New Orleans metro area, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes are possible in outer rainbands beginning Friday; prolonged river flooding may follow due to heavy runoff.
